00178   
00180       DArray<Atom*>  atom1Ptrs_;  
00181 
00183       DArray<Atom*>  atom2Ptrs_;  
00184 
00186       DArray<int>    first_; 
00187 
00189       double cutoff_;
00190    
00192       int    atomCapacity_;     
00193    
00195       int    pairCapacity_;     
00196    
00198       int    nAtom1_;      
00199 
00201       int    nAtom2_; 
00202    
00204       int    maxNAtomLocal_;     
00205    
00207       int    maxNPairLocal_;     
00208    
00210       int    buildCounter_;
00211 
00213       Setable<int>  maxNAtom_;     
00214    
00216       Setable<int>  maxNPair_;     
00217    
00219       bool   isAllocated_;
00220   
00221       /* 
00222       * Implementation Notes:
00223       *
00224       * The pair list is stored in Atom* pointer arrays atom1Ptrs_, atom2Ptrs_, 
00225       * and in an integer array first_. Each element of atom1Ptrs_ contains a 
00226       * pointer to the first atom in a pair (the primary Atom). Each element 
00227       * of atom2Ptrs_ contains a pointer to the second atom in a pair (the 
00228       * secondary Atom).  Secondary atoms that are neighbors of the same 
00229       * primary atom are listed consecutively.  Element first_[i] contains the 
00230       * array index of the first element in atom2Ptrs_ that contains a neighbor 
00231       * of primary atom atom1Ptrs_[i]. Pointers to neighbors of primary atom
00232       * *atom1Ptrs_[i] are thus stored in elements first_[i] <= j < first_[i+1]
00233       * of atom2Ptrs_.  Each pair is included only once.
00234       *
00235       * The only way legal way to loop over all atom pairs, using the public 
00236       * interface of a PairList, is to use a PairListIterator. See the 
00237       * documentation of PairListIterator for a discussion of its usage. The 
00238       * resulting loop over pairs is equivalent to the following double loop 
00239       * over private member variables of PairList:
00240       * 
00241       *    int i, j;
00242       *    Atom* atom1Ptr;
00243       *    Atom* atom2Ptr;
00244       *
00245       *    \\ Loop over primary Atoms
00246       *    for (i = 0; i < nAtom1_; ++i) {
00247       *       atom1Ptr = atom1Ptrs_[i];
00248       *
00249       *       // Loop over secondary atoms
00250       *       for (j = first_[i]; j < first_[i+1]; ++j) {
00251       *           atom2Ptr = atom2Ptrs_[j];
00252       *
00253       *           // ... Do something with Atoms *atom1Ptr and *atom2Ptr.
00254       *
00255       *       }
00256       *    }
00257       *
00258       * Note that DArray<int> first_ contains nAtom1_ + 1 elements. The first
00259       * element, element first_[0] is equal to 0, and the last element,
00260       * first_[nAtom1_], is always equal to nAtom2_, the total number of 
00261       * pairs.
00262       */
00263 
00264    }; 
00265 
00266    /*
00267    * Get the current number of primary atoms in the pairlist.
00268    */ 
00269    inline int PairList::nAtom() const
00270    { return nAtom1_; }
00271 
00272    /*
00273    * Get the current number of pairs.
00274    */ 
00275    inline int PairList::nPair() const
00276    { return nAtom2_; }
00277 
00281    inline int PairList::pairCapacity() const
00282    {  return pairCapacity_; }
00283 
00287    inline int PairList::atomCapacity() const
00288    {  return atomCapacity_; }
00289 
00290    /*
00291    * Get the maximum value of aAtom() since instantiation.
00292    */ 
00293    inline int PairList::maxNAtom() const
00294    { return maxNAtom_.value(); }
00295 
00296    /*
00297    * Get the maximum value of nPair() since instantiation.
00298    */ 
00299    inline int PairList::maxNPair() const
00300    { return maxNPair_.value(); }
00301 
00302    /*
00303    * Get the number of times this PairList has been built.
00304    */ 
00305    inline int PairList::buildCounter() const
00306    { return buildCounter_; }
00307 
00308    /*
00309    * Has memory been allocated for this PairList?
00310    */ 
00311    inline bool PairList::isAllocated() const
00312    { return isAllocated_; }
